Dear Ms. Reynolds:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 hit and pushed Youth A during a physical altercation.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 12/19/2023 during an
unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Documentation and
video footage was gathered, but no further information was
provided.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/27/2023
during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. Staff 1
recalled the incident in question. He stated he was one of several
staff that were in the day room in the boy’s unit. Most of the youth
were sitting at tables playing cards or Youth Card games. Staff 1
recalled Youth A had gotten out of his seat, and he was not
supposed to per his current privileges at that time. Staff 1 stated
Youth A had spent much of the day in an agitated state, “flinching”
at other youth and staff to make it look like he was going to punch
someone without actually attempting to. Staff 1 recalled Youth C
then taking a laptop computer that was sitting on a nearby table
and walking around the room to then throw it in the trash. Staff 1
approached the trash can and he recalled Youth A then
approached him and flinched at him again. Staff 1 stated he held
his hands out to keep space away from Youth A only for Youth A
to back up and fall backwards. Staff 1 was not sure if Youth A fell
over. Staff 1 recalled Youth A then re-approached him and threw
a punch at Staff 1. Staff 1 stated that the situation then escalated
quickly and all he could remember was that he moved to the
corner of the room and then fell onto the floor of the room with
several youth attempting to punch and kick him. He could not
recall exactly who that was. Staff 1 stated he never punched back
at Youth A or any other youth involved. Staff 1 remembered being
hit in the face at multiple points during the incident. Video footage
of the incident was reviewed with Staff 1. He could not remember
exactly what he said to Youth A as he approached and pointed
towards him but believed that he was asking if Youth A could shut
the door to the nearby bathroom. Staff 1 stated he could not recall
punching Youth A back as things initially escalated physically. He
stated he might have been putting his arms up to block Youth A’s
punches. Staff 1 stated he had no intention of hurting Youth A or
any other youth involved. Staff 1 was asked what training he had
received for physical incidents such as this. He stated staff are
trained to put their hands up and attempt to move away or position
themselves in a manner to create distance from an attacking
youth and allow for their own protection. Staff 1 was spoken with
later that same day and he clarified that he had spoken with the
Chief Administrator and Supervisor about the incident after the
2

fact to debrief it properly. He stated the first time he had seen
video footage of the incident was during the interview, and that if
the video showed him hitting Youth A it was done in self-defense.
Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/27/2023
during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. When
recalling the incident in question, Youth A stated it started when
Staff 1 approached him and stated points were going to be taken
away from Youth A for not listening to staff. Youth A stated he
began to approach Staff 1 as Staff 1 was already approaching
him, and that he “flinched” on Staff 1. Youth A stated he had been
doing that all day to other staff, only to “mess around” with them.
Youth A recalled Staff 1 then pushed Youth A back and Youth A
fell backwards to the ground. Youth A recalled getting up and
then punching Staff 1. Youth A stated they began to fight and he
could not remember exactly what occurred next because he
“blacked out.” Youth A thought Staff 1 might have punched him
back. Youth A recalled throwing more punches at Staff 1 and the
other youth that he could not specify joining in to attack Staff 1.
Youth A described the rest of the incident as a “riot” after Staff 1
removed himself from the day room, where the fight began, into
the building’s control room.
Youth B was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/27/2023
during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. He stated
he was in full view of the whole incident as it began and evolved.
Youth B stated he saw Youth A punch Staff 1 and then Staff 1
punch Youth A back. He believed he saw Staff 1 punch Youth A
multiple times and then pull him to the ground by his hair. Youth B
stated he joined the fight at that time and punched Staff 1 several
times. He stated he only did this because he thought it was
inappropriate for Staff 1 to punch Youth A in the first place.
Youth C was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/27/2023
during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. He stated
the entire incident began because he picked up a laptop computer
that was on a table in the day room and threw it in the trash.
Youth C recalled Staff 1 then approached that trash can and
asked Youth C to pick up the computer. Youth C stated he heard
Youth A say to Staff 1 “I should beat your ass” as Staff 1
approached the area where Youth A was standing. Youth C
stated he then saw Staff 1 push Youth A backwards, Youth A then
got up and threw a punch at Staff 1. Youth C stated that he then
saw Staff 1 ball up his fist and punch Youth A once or twice in the
face or chest. Youth C stated chaos then ensued, with several
youth getting up and attempting to hit and kick Staff 1. Youth C
3

admitted to trying to hit Staff 1 as well, stating he was upset that
Staff 1 would punch back at a 14 year old youth.
Youth D was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/27/2023
during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. He stated
he was present for the incident in question and that it started with
Youth C throwing a computer in a trash can. Youth D recalled
Youth A then approached Staff 1 and raised his voice at him, and
then Staff 1 pushed Youth A backwards. Youth D stated Youth A
then threw a punch at Staff 1, and then Staff 1 hit Youth A back.
Youth D stated he was one of the youth that then attempted to
fight Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/27/2023
during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. She stated
that she was working in the day room on the date in question and
was involved in the riot. Staff 2 saw Youth C take a laptop
computer and throw it in the trash, which prompted Staff 1 to walk
over to the trash can. Staff 2 stated she then left the day room to
the control room which is connected, to call upstairs to Chief
Administrator. She stated she did not see the initial punches or
physical activity, only that she saw several youth attempt to hit
and kick Staff 1. Staff 2 stated she then went back into the day
room to attempt to quell the fight as it increased. She recalled
attempting to restrain several youth, including Youth A, to pull
them out of attacking Staff 1. Staff 2 believed she was able to
hold Youth A back from Staff 1, which allowed him to leave the
day room and be away from the youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/27/2023
during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. She stated
she was in the other unit when the incident began to occur. She
recalled already making her way to the day room because she
was going to switch out with another staff when she heard on the
radio that help was needed. Staff 3 stated she rushed into the day
room to see Staff 2 pulling Youth A back from Staff 1, and other
youth that she could not name attempting to hit and kick Staff 1.
Staff 3 stated other youth not involved in the fighting told her that it
all occurred because Staff 1 punched Youth A.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on
12/27/2023 during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility.
Supervisor 1 stated he was not involved in the incident in
question. He was interviewed because he was one of the
approved and trained instructors for the facility restraint model.
Supervisor 1 stated staff are not trained to punch youth while in
4

escalated situations, but that they are trained to use defensive
stances in response to youth attacking. They are also trained to
attempt to move away from youth as best they can to create
space and reduce the chance of further escalation.
Staff 4 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 01/08/2024
during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. He stated
he was working on the day in question, and that he had interacted
with Youth A several times earlier that day. Staff 4 recalled Youth
A “flinching” at staff several times that day. Staff 4 stated he was
sitting at a table playing cards when the physical incident
occurred. He had his back turned when he heard Youth A say
something “in an aggressive tone”, but he could not recall what
was said. Staff 4 saw Staff 1 put his hands out to keep Youth A
from approaching him too closely. Staff 4 believed that Youth A
may have fallen to the floor, but then he got back up and re-
approached Staff 1 aggressively. Staff 4 stated he was not sure
what happened next, but that he heard Youth B yell “Hey, you
can’t hit a little kid” and then tried to lunge at Staff 1. Staff 4
stated he attempted to hold Youth B back from attacking Staff 1.
Staff 4 believed other youth then attempted to attack Staff 1 but
could not recall who. Staff 4 stated he let Youth B go. He then
left the day room and entered into the control room. He stated he
was intending to call law enforcement at that point, but also stated
he did not believe he communicated where he was going to the
staff still in the day room engaging with the escalated youth.
The facility Nurse was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on
12/27/2023 during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility.
She stated she spoke with Youth A after the incident and that he
denied any injuries. The Nurse stated she had been told by the
Chief Administrator that Youth A had reported his hair hurt after
the fight, but Youth A did not disclose this during their time
speaking together. The nurse did not see any injuries to Youth A.
Documentation reviewed:
• The personnel record for Staff 1 was reviewed. There was
no discipline noted and it was confirmed that he was
properly trained in the facility restraint model.
• As of 12/14/2023 Staff 1 was placed on leave, and it was
confirmed on 12/27/2023 that this was indefinite pending
the outcome of the investigation.
• An Incident Report dated 12/14/2023 was provided and
reviewed. Sections were authored by Staff 1, Staff 4, Staff
3 any, Staff 2 and the Chief Administrator. This
documentation noted many similar elements to interviews
5

provided by staff. In the section authored by Staff 1 he
described putting his hands out in front of Youth A as Youth
A approached him, only for Youth A to slip backwards.
Youth A then got back up and threw several punches at
Staff 1, and Staff 1 attempted to block these punches and
was hit once or twice in the face. Staff 1 then described
backing up towards the center of the room only for several
other youth to then attempt to hit him.
• Facility policy was reviewed titled “Emergency Restraint”
and last revised as of August 2023. This policy outlines
that emergency restraints are only to be utilized when all
other interventions are utilized but fail to protect youth or
others from aggressive behavior. There is not any
language in this policy that outlines specific behaviors or
strategies for staff when youth are attacking them.
• Video footage of the incident was provided and viewed.
The footage began in the early evening of 12/14/2023.
Several youths were sitting around the day room area with
Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 4 in the room with them. At
4:00:04 pm Youth C was seen getting up and taking a
computer off of a nearby table, then walking over to the far
wall and dropping it in the trash can. About 30 seconds
later, Staff 1 walks toward that trash can and Youth A
approaches him quickly. Staff 1 put his hands out and
pushed Youth A backwards. Youth A did not fall to the
ground. Youth A then gathered himself and then re-
approached Staff 1 and threw a punch with his right hand.
Staff 1 then punched back with his right hand. A scuffle
ensued with both individuals’ hands on each other and
pushing, with Youth A throwing multiple punches at Staff 1.
This drifted to the far corner of the room where another
youth that cannot be distinguished picked up a chair and
threw it at Staff 1. Staff 1 ended up in the corner of the
room with several youth attacking him. He then was able to
get away and, in an effort, to get to the back wall away from
the attacking youth, Staff 1 fell and was hit and kicked by
several youth. Staff 2 can be seen attempting to block and
restrain youth away from attacking Staff 1. Staff 4 can be
seen leaving the group and going into the control room.
Staff 1 is eventually able to get into the control room and
away from youth attempting to attack him. No concerns
were noted on how staff attempted to handle the escalated
situation after the initial part of it.
DHHS Worker 1 had findings in their investigation and a staff
member was confirmed.
6

Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff, video footage and other
documentation reviewed, there is evidence to show that Staff 1
punched back at Youth A during an escalated incident and
therefore this rule was violated.
Technical Assistance provided:
• It was discussed with the Chief Administrator that an
incident of this magnitude should require significant
debriefing after the fact, including video review of staff
involved for both negative and positive aspects of what
occurred.
• The facility is advised to revise their behavior management
policy for clarity to staff on what responses to physical
aggression from youth are acceptable and what are not.
Consultation provided:
• The facility is advised to have discussion and planning
surrounding how staff members can effectively team and
communicate with each other while an escalated incident is
occurring in order to produce the safest outcome for all
involved.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
